title: North Dakota beats Bemidji State 5-2
text:
Boeser has hat trick in North Dakota's 5-2 win over Bemidji State THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   10:48   10:48   
Subjects: 
North Dakota (276) 

GRAND FORKS, North Dakota â€” Freshman Brock Boeser scored three goals as North Dakota beat Bemidji State 5-2 Saturday in men's college hockey. 
North Dakota outscored the Beavers 3-0 in the third period. 
Boeser's power-play goal in the third period, his second of the game, came just seven seconds into a five-minute power play and provided insurance. He added a third goal into the empty net with 1:20 left. 
UND dominated the third period of its home opener. Troy Stecher scored the go-ahead goal at 11:37 of the third. Boeser scored 38 seconds later. 
Drake Caggiula added a goal and three assists for UND (2-0-2), which tied 4-4 with the Beavers (1-1-1) on Friday. 
UND goalie Matt Hrynkiw had 18 saves. 
The Beavers' Gerry Fitzgerald scored both of his team's goals. He also had a goal on Friday. 
Bemidji State goalie Michael Bitzer turned away 25 shots.
